description:
This meditation and mindfulness course brings together the world's leading researchers, neuroscientists, and master teachers to provide a comprehensive, science-based journey from beginner to advanced practice.

You'll learn from the pioneers who literally created the field of contemplative neuroscience - like Richard Davidson, who brought Buddhist monks into brain imaging labs, and Jon Kabat-Zinn, who developed MBSR and brought mindfulness into mainstream medicine. You'll hear from professors at Oxford, Harvard, Brown, and the University of Wisconsin whose research proves meditation causes measurable changes in brain structure and function.

The course progression mirrors how meditation expertise develops: starting with accessible introductions from master teachers and well-known hosts (like Rick Rubin interviewing Jon Kabat-Zinn and Andy Puddicombe sharing his journey from Buddhist monk to Headspace founder), moving to deeper explorations of clinical applications and neural mechanisms (like Willem Kuyken's research at Oxford on preventing depression and Judson Brewer's work on breaking habits), and culminating in cutting-edge research and advanced practice insights (like Daniel Goleman discussing decades of contemplative science evolution and Jack Kornfield guiding practice).

Every episode features an expert being interviewed - neuroscientists publishing in Nature and Science, clinical psychologists at top universities, former Buddhist monks, and master teachers with 50+ years of experience. You'll understand not just WHAT meditation is, but HOW it works at the neural level, WHY it's effective for specific challenges like anxiety and habits, and WHAT the research actually shows. From Amishi Jha's groundbreaking attention research to Sara Lazar's Harvard studies on brain structure changes, you'll gain insights from the forefront of contemplative neuroscience.

Whether you're new to meditation or deepening an existing practice, you'll gain the scientific knowledge and practical insights from the world's foremost experts in contemplative neuroscience, clinical psychology, and meditation teaching.
